sub_title: Solution designer; business analyst and product owner in Technology, Media & Telecommunications
summary:
Determined project manager; business analyst and solution designer with a strong marketing background and broad technological knowledge in the technology, media and telecommunications industry.

Currently responsible for key innovation projects to shape future roadmap for live streaming and Video-on-Demand services and its end-to-end integration with customer backend systems (e.g. video backends and players; provisioning; authentication; payment & billing; app development; recommendation platforms; video advertisements; operational workflows and BI) for various telco's in Europe and Asia, part of M7/Canal+ Group.

Especially interested in cloud-based solutions and working in innovative environments.

✔	Experience

Coordinated multiple projects with different characteristics ranging from single-domain and single supplier to multi-domain and multi-supplier, dealing with a broad spectrum of (business) stakeholders including multiple internal and external suppliers.

Responsible for multiple development teams ranging from front-end to back-end development for key projects  Responsible for delivery of key features and functionalities within new projects.

Consulting and advising stakeholders up to C-level in designing and deploying solutions.

Designing solutions for Stream-Group's service delivery platform, integration in its core platform and roll-out to customers. Working on innovation roadmap. 

✔	Goals

- Achieve an challenging and interesting position in the technology, media and telecommunications industry.
- Work together with inspiring people to deliver existing and innovative services to end-users.
- Keep learning every single day to improve myself and the companies I am involved with.

✔	Specialties

- Business analysis
- System integration
- Streaming media
- Recommendation systems
- Payment integration

profile_positions.description:
✔ Product Developer; (Technical) Project Manager; Business Analyst for multi-screen television solutions at Stream Group, part of M7 and Canal+ Group

Primarily focusing on solution design + end-to-end integration of multi-screen TV and Video-on-Demand (TV Everywhere) services for various telco's in Europe, including subsidiaries of France Télécom's mobile division Orange; Vodafone; and subsidiaries of M7 Group S.A. and Canal+

• Product Development: designing solutions for Stream-Group's TV platform and its integration with customer systems (e.g. streaming back-ends; provisioning; payment & billing; CMS; relevant 3rd party systems). Managing multiple development teams to delivering services to end-users.

• Customer project management: responsible for alignment in planning, scope, development, build, test and handover of new releases and functionalities for the multi-screen TV platform of Stream-Group and integration with customer (back-end) systems. Technical project manager and external consultant within platform migration projects.

• Business Analyst: serving as mediator between (internal & external) technical and business stakeholders, including advising stakeholders up to C-level. Analyzing sets of requirements and creating functional/implementation requirements for development teams

✔	Graduate Internship Bachelor of Commerce

Conducted exploratory reseach and participated in the feasibility studies and start-up phase for HeerlenLive: multiple combined initiatives from the municipality of Heerlen in the field of new media and technology. 

HeerlenLive comprises a municipal wireless project for free public wireless internet access and the development of a multichannel network combining urban screens, digital signage, mobile and web for delivering location-based services.

HeerlenLive was a finalist for the VVV Rob de Bes Award 2010

Furthermore I investigated key factors of successful IT regions and opportunities for the municipality of Heerlen's positioning within the Eindhoven-Leuven-Aachen triangle, a geographical area of high-tech activity in the Dutch, Belgian and German cross-border region.
